channel.title: How to Backup/Copy PS2 Games/DVDs
channel.description:
[center][size=15pt][b]How to Backup/Copy PS2 Games/DVDs[/b][/size][/center]
Copying PS2 games/DVDs is very simple. The requirements to copy is to have a DVD writer, a blank DVD, and a program called DVD Decrypter. [url=http://fileforum.betanews.com/detail/DVD_Decrypter/1011845169/1]Click here to Download and Install DVD Decrypter.[/url]
[b]Step 1[/b]. Insert your PS2 Game/DVD into your DVD writer drive.
[b]Step 2[/b]. Open up DVD Decrypter and make sure to have your Source selected as whatever drive you're PS2 game is in. Mine is in the E drive which is my DVD Writer drive. Click on Mode > ISO > Read. Then, under where it says Destination, click on the browse button and choose a destination of your .ISO file. [img]http://img258.imageshack.us/img258/2607/dvd18re.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 3[/b]. Then click on the DVD to Harddrive button. This should take around 5 minutes. Depending on the speed of your DVD Writer. [img]http://img127.imageshack.us/img127/439/dvd20cn.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 4[/b]. When it's finished, take your PS2 game/DVD out and place it back in its box or whatever. Then get your blank [b]DVD-R[/b] and insert it into your DVD writer. Now, in DVD Decrypter, go to Mode > ISO > Write. Where it says Source, click on the browse button and find your .ISO file. It should be where you chose its destination in Step 2. [img]http://img524.imageshack.us/img524/8620/dvd37vx.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 5[/b]. Finally, click on the Harddrive to DVD button to burn it onto your DVD. This should take around 10 minutes. Depending on the speed of your DVD Writer. Yay it's finished! [img]http://img524.imageshack.us/img524/3705/dvd48vm.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 6[/b]. Take out your new copied DVD backup of one of your PS2 games and run to your PS2. Turn it on, insert the DVD, and see if it works. If it works, you owe me money. Naw jk, but if it works then you did everything right! If it didn't work, then you either don't have a mod chip for your PS2 or DVD Decryptor didn't burn it properly, or [img]http://img127.imageshack.us/img127/7260/dvd54gg.jpg[/img]
If it doesn't, then post here and I'll try to cyber slap you and update this guide somehow so no one else would make your mistake. :)
How did I figure this out? I looked on numerous websites on google searching for DVD decrypter and how to copy PS2 Games/DVDs. Here is one of my sources. [url=http://forums.afterdawn.com/thread_view.cfm/117975]AfterDawn.com[/url]
~Ron :D

item.title: How to Backup/Copy PS2 Games/DVDs
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

DVD decrypter was made just for DVDs but later became for games too. So yeah you can extract images with dvd decryptor of your DVD. Not all DVDs though. I couldn’t extract one with VOB encryption. I’m going to rewrite this tutorial for Alcohol 120%. You can set the datatype for that Alcohol 120% for VOB and it breaks the encryption.

Just wait, I’ll update this soon enough, school is starting soon so I may not get to it for a little while.

Read full topic

item.title: How to Backup/Copy PS2 Games/DVDs
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Swap magic versions above 2 use PS2 game encryption and you won’t be able to run that on your PS2 without a mod chip lol and with a mod chip, you don’t even need swap magic.

Oh and mod chips are $10 frostbyte. So I would buy that, cause otherwise you’ll have to hunt down a copy of swap magic.

item.title: How to Backup/Copy PS2 Games/DVDs
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Don’t go for a mod chip. Go for SoftMod. All you have to do is download a softmod, plant the image on a CD, and shove the cd into your PS2. It will install software onto your PS2 which will allow you to play backed up/copied games.

Swap Magic is nice. Just dl it from torrents or you have to pay for it. :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

What is what you mean? In this thread all you said before was…

“Ron you do realise that the purpose of Swap Magic 3 is to enable you to use copied discs, and you just posted a link to a torrent with an iso file… >>”

What does that have to do with “You can’t boot it into teh ps2 because it is a copied disc”? lol. I do realize that though.

Yes tom55, you need to buy it. They cost $20 to $60. Sometimes more. But just think… if you copied 2 games, that’s $100 right there. Copy about 20 more, and you’re already getting a lot more than you paid for. For FREE!

Read full topic

item.title: How to Backup/Copy PS2 Games/DVDs
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:10, topic:4534”]Rictoo that link doesn’t post to a .iso file. It points to a torrent you need to download then mount the image files on to two different disks and finally boot them into your PS2.

Oh and, I also forgot to mention in this tutorial about a program that can copy and game. It is banned in the USA and I have been looking everywhere to download it. It’s called Game X Copy by 321 Studios. You can buy the software on eBay and other auction sites, but I can’t find any active torrents for it.

I also heard that Alcohol 120% burns copied games to a 1:1 ratio. I’ll download it and check it out. Be back with news next time I post.[/quote]

That’s what i mean. You can’t boot it into teh ps2 because it is a copied disc

item.title: How to Backup/Copy PS2 Games/DVDs
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Damit. Another way to copy disks is by Alcohol 120%. But, it doesn’t burn it all the way because the games use boot sectors which can’t be copied by software on your computer, they can only be copied by the heavy machinery big companies use which burn press them. Those sell for 10s of 1000s of dollars.

So the only way to make backups/copies of games is to have your console modded which will trick your game system into thinking it has boot sectors and just play the game.

This is kind of fishy since other countries like in India have so many boot leg versions of games and those are $5 to $10 and are burnt perfectly. Those guys must have a burn press machine or something.

Read full topic
